com.jinvoke
Enum CallingConvention

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<CallingConvention>
      com.jinvoke.CallingConvention
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<CallingConvention>
public enum CallingConvention
extends java.lang.Enum<CallingConvention>

Indicates the calling convention of a native function. The calling convention is a standardized method for a program to pass parameters to a function and receive a result value back from it. All native functions use a calling convention, that describes how they receive function parameters and return results.

The calling convention is typically spcified in the method signature in header files, or in the associated documentation.
For example, in the following method declaration from a header file, WINAPI (STDCALL) refers to the calling convention: extern "C" WINAPI __declspec(dllexport) int NmcInit(char *portname, unsigned int baudrate); If a calling convention is not specified, J/Invoke uses the STDCALL calling convention.

Enum Constant Detail

STDCALL

public static final CallingConvention STDCALL
The standard-call calling convention. This is the calling convention used by the Win32 API and is the default calling convention used by J/Invoke. Use this when calling the Win32 API, or methods declared as using WINAPI or STDCALL.

CDECL

public static final CallingConvention CDECL
The cdecl calling convention. This is the calling convention used by the C runtime library. Use this when calling the C-runtime library. Also, Visual C++, 32 bit edition uses cdecl as the default calling convention. If no calling convention is specified, use CDECL.

THISCALL

public static final CallingConvention THISCALL
The thiscall calling convention (described here). This is the default calling convention used by C++ member functions that do not use variable arguments. (For variardic functions, the cdecl convention is used.) When using THISCALL calling convention, the first argument of the method must be a Java int holding the address of the c++ object.

an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared
